p: Taken together, these examples show the incalculable power of human ingenuity to imagine new possibilities in a predicament. Importantly, recognising—but not denying—climate change as a human predicament offers us to see the possibility of living with a changing climate (Hulme 2020c). From this perspective, climate change may be seen ‘unsolvable’, but it could still be a political and moral force to liberate the present from the legacy of a past that none of us chose and lead to the future of our choosing.
